Detailed Description

The HarvardHand hand has a special DOF that allows the passively coupled joint to breakaway.

The HarvardHand hand has a special feature that allows the passively coupled outer joint of each finger to continue to close if the inner link is stopped by a contact. As the finger opens again the joint becomes recoupled when it reaches the point when the breakaway first occurred. This only works when dynamics is off. We just need to add some code to check a torque threshold to determine when breakaway occurs during dynamic simulation.
